clauses-english.clause: Alif,
Lam,
Meem.

3471.verse-english: These are verses of the wise Book,

clauses-english.clause: These are verses of the wise Book,

3472.verse-english: As guidance and mercy for the doers of good

clauses-english.clause: As guidance and mercy for the doers of good

3473.verse-arabic: الَّذِينَ يُقِيمُونَ الصَّلَاةَ وَيُؤْتُونَ الزَّكَاةَ وَهُم بِالْآخِرَةِ هُمْ يُوقِنُونَ
3473.verse-english: Who establish prayer and give zakah, and they, of the Hereafter, are certain [in faith].

clauses-english.clause: Who establish prayer and give zakah,
and they,
of the Hereafter,
are certain [in faith].

3474.verse-arabic: أُولَٰئِكَ عَلَىٰ هُدًى مِّن رَّبِّهِمْ ۖ وَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْمُفْلِحُونَ
3474.verse-english: Those are on [right] guidance from their Lord, and it is those who are the successful.

clauses-english.clause: Those are on [right] guidance from their Lord,
and it is those who are the successful.

3475.verse-arabic: وَمِنَ النَّاسِ مَن يَشْتَرِي لَهْوَ الْحَدِيثِ لِيُضِلَّ عَن سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍ وَيَتَّخِذَهَا هُزُوًا ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ مُّهِينٌ
3475.verse-english: And of the people is he who buys the amusement of speech to mislead [others] from the way of Allah without knowledge and who takes it in ridicule. Those will have a humiliating punishment.

clauses-english.clause: And of the people is he who buys the amusement of speech to mislead [others] from the way of God without knowledge and who takes it in ridicule.
Those will have a humiliating punishment.

3476.verse-arabic: وَإِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ آيَاتُنَا وَلَّىٰ مُسْتَكْبِرًا كَأَن لَّمْ يَسْمَعْهَا كَأَنَّ فِي أُذُنَيْهِ وَقْرًا ۖ فَبَشِّرْهُ بِعَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ
3476.verse-english: And when our verses are recited to him, he turns away arrogantly as if he had not heard them, as if there was in his ears deafness. So give him tidings of a painful punishment.

clauses-english.clause: And when our verses are recited to him,
he turns away arrogantly as if he had not heard them,
as if there was in his ears deafness.
So give him tidings of a painful punishment.

3477.verse-arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ لَهُمْ جَنَّاتُ النَّعِيمِ
3477.verse-english: Indeed, those who believe and do righteous deeds - for them are the Gardens of Pleasure.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
those who believe and do righteous deeds -
for them are the Gardens of Pleasure.

3478.verse-arabic: خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا ۖ وَعْدَ اللَّهِ حَقًّا ۚ وَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ
3478.verse-english: Wherein they abide eternally; [it is] the promise of Allah [which is] truth. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

clauses-english.clause: Wherein they abide eternally;
[it is] the promise of God [which is] truth.
And He is the Exalted in Might,
the Wise.

3479.verse-arabic: خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ بِغَيْرِ عَمَدٍ تَرَوْنَهَا ۖ وَأَلْقَىٰ فِي الْأَرْضِ رَوَاسِيَ أَن تَمِيدَ بِكُمْ وَبَثَّ فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ دَابَّةٍ ۚ وَأَنزَلْنَا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً فَأَنبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوْجٍ كَرِيمٍ
3479.verse-english: He created the heavens without pillars that you see and has cast into the earth firmly set mountains, lest it should shift with you, and dispersed therein from every creature. And We sent down rain from the sky and made grow therein [plants] of every noble kind.

clauses-english.clause: He created the heavens without pillars that you see and has cast into the earth firmly set mountains,
lest it should shift with you,
and dispersed therein from every creature.
And We sent down rain from the sky and made grow therein [plants] of every noble kind.

3480.verse-arabic: هَٰذَا خَلْقُ اللَّهِ فَأَرُونِي مَاذَا خَلَقَ الَّذِينَ مِن دُونِهِ ۚ بَلِ الظَّالِمُونَ فِي ضَلَالٍ مُّبِينٍ
3480.verse-english: This is the creation of Allah. So show Me what those other than Him have created. Rather, the wrongdoers are in clear error.

clauses-english.clause: This is the creation of God.
So show Me what those other than Him have created.
Rather,
the wrongdoers are in clear error.

3481.verse-arabic: وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَا لُقْمَانَ الْحِكْمَةَ أَنِ اشْكُرْ لِلَّهِ ۚ وَمَن يَشْكُرْ فَإِنَّمَا يَشْكُرُ لِنَفْسِهِ ۖ وَمَن كَفَرَ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ غَنِيٌّ حَمِيدٌ
3481.verse-english: And We had certainly given Luqman wisdom [and said], "Be grateful to Allah." And whoever is grateful is grateful for [the benefit of] himself. And whoever denies [His favor] - then indeed, Allah is Free of need and Praiseworthy.

clauses-english.clause: And We had certainly given Luqman wisdom [and said],
"Be grateful to God.
" And whoever is grateful is grateful for [the benefit of] himself.
And whoever denies [His favor] -
then indeed,
God is Free of need and Praiseworthy.

3482.verse-arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَ لُقْمَانُ لِابْنِهِ وَهُوَ يَعِظُهُ يَا بُنَيَّ لَا تُشْرِكْ بِاللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّ الشِّرْكَ لَظُلْمٌ عَظِيمٌ
3482.verse-english: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Luqman said to his son while he was instructing him, "O my son, do not associate [anything] with Allah. Indeed, association [with him] is great injustice."

clauses-english.clause: And [mention,
O Muhammad],
when Luqman said to his son while he was instructing him,
"O my son,
do not associate [anything] with God.
Indeed,
association [with him] is great injustice.

3483.verse-arabic: وَوَصَّيْنَا الْإِنسَانَ بِوَالِدَيْهِ حَمَلَتْهُ أُمُّهُ وَهْنًا عَلَىٰ وَهْنٍ وَفِصَالُهُ فِي عَامَيْنِ أَنِ اشْكُرْ لِي وَلِوَالِدَيْكَ إِلَيَّ الْمَصِيرُ
3483.verse-english: And We have enjoined upon man [care] for his parents. His mother carried him, [increasing her] in weakness upon weakness, and his weaning is in two years. Be grateful to Me and to your parents; to Me is the [final] destination.

clauses-english.clause: And We have enjoined upon man [care] for his parents.
His mother carried him,
[increasing her] in weakness upon weakness,
and his weaning is in two years.
Be grateful to Me and to your parents;
to Me is the [final] destination.

3484.verse-arabic: وَإِن جَاهَدَاكَ عَلَىٰ أَن تُشْرِكَ بِي مَا لَيْسَ لَكَ بِهِ عِلْمٌ فَلَا تُطِعْهُمَا ۖ وَصَاحِبْهُمَا فِي الدُّنْيَا مَعْرُوفًا ۖ وَاتَّبِعْ سَبِيلَ مَنْ أَنَابَ إِلَيَّ ۚ ثُمَّ إِلَيَّ مَرْجِعُكُمْ فَأُنَبِّئُكُم بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
3484.verse-english: But if they endeavor to make you associate with Me that of which you have no knowledge, do not obey them but accompany them in [this] world with appropriate kindness and follow the way of those who turn back to Me [in repentance]. Then to Me will be your return, and I will inform you about what you used to do.

clauses-english.clause: But if they endeavor to make you associate with Me that of which you have no knowledge,
do not obey them but accompany them in [this] world with appropriate kindness and follow the way of those who turn back to Me [in repentance].
Then to Me will be your return,
and I will inform you about what you used to do.

3485.verse-arabic: يَا بُنَيَّ إِنَّهَا إِن تَكُ مِثْقَالَ حَبَّةٍ مِّنْ خَرْدَلٍ فَتَكُن فِي صَخْرَةٍ أَوْ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ أَوْ فِي الْأَرْضِ يَأْتِ بِهَا اللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَطِيفٌ خَبِيرٌ
3485.verse-english: [And Luqman said], "O my son, indeed if wrong should be the weight of a mustard seed and should be within a rock or [anywhere] in the heavens or in the earth, Allah will bring it forth. Indeed, Allah is Subtle and Acquainted.

clauses-english.clause: [And Luqman said],
"O my son,
indeed if wrong should be the weight of a mustard seed and should be within a rock or [anywhere] in the heavens or in the earth,
God will bring it forth.
Indeed,
God is Subtle and Acquainted.

3486.verse-arabic: يَا بُنَيَّ أَقِمِ الصَّلَاةَ وَأْمُرْ بِالْمَعْرُوفِ وَانْهَ عَنِ الْمُنكَرِ وَاصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا أَصَابَكَ ۖ إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ مِنْ عَزْمِ الْأُمُورِ
3486.verse-english: O my son, establish prayer, enjoin what is right, forbid what is wrong, and be patient over what befalls you. Indeed, [all] that is of the matters [requiring] determination.

clauses-english.clause: O my son,
establish prayer,
enjoin what is right,
forbid what is wrong,
and be patient over what befalls you.
Indeed,
[all] that is of the matters [requiring] determination.

3487.verse-arabic: وَلَا تُصَعِّرْ خَدَّكَ لِلنَّاسِ وَلَا تَمْشِ فِي الْأَرْضِ مَرَحًا ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يُحِبُّ كُلَّ مُخْتَالٍ فَخُورٍ
3487.verse-english: And do not turn your cheek [in contempt] toward people and do not walk through the earth exultantly. Indeed, Allah does not like everyone self-deluded and boastful.

clauses-english.clause: And do not turn your cheek [in contempt] toward people and do not walk through the earth exultantly.
Indeed,
God does not like everyone self-
deluded and boastful.

3488.verse-arabic: وَاقْصِدْ فِي مَشْيِكَ وَاغْضُضْ مِن صَوْتِكَ ۚ إِنَّ أَنكَرَ الْأَصْوَاتِ لَصَوْتُ الْحَمِيرِ
3488.verse-english: And be moderate in your pace and lower your voice; indeed, the most disagreeable of sounds is the voice of donkeys."

clauses-english.clause: And be moderate in your pace and lower your voice;
indeed,
the most disagreeable of sounds is the voice of donkeys.

3489.verse-arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَوْا أَنَّ اللَّهَ سَخَّرَ لَكُم مَّا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ وَأَسْبَغَ عَلَيْكُمْ نِعَمَهُ ظَاهِرَةً وَبَاطِنَةً ۗ وَمِنَ النَّاسِ مَن يُجَادِلُ فِي اللَّهِ بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍ وَلَا هُدًى وَلَا كِتَابٍ مُّنِيرٍ
3489.verse-english: Do you not see that Allah has made subject to you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth and amply bestowed upon you His favors, [both] apparent and unapparent? But of the people is he who disputes about Allah without knowledge or guidance or an enlightening Book [from Him].

clauses-english.clause: Do you not see that God has made subject to you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth and amply bestowed upon you His favors,
[both] apparent and unapparent?
But of the people is he who disputes about God without knowledge or guidance or an enlightening Book [from Him].

3490.verse-arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ اتَّبِعُوا مَا أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ قَالُوا بَلْ نَتَّبِعُ مَا وَجَدْنَا عَلَيْهِ آبَاءَنَا ۚ أَوَلَوْ كَانَ الشَّيْطَانُ يَدْعُوهُمْ إِلَىٰ عَذَابِ السَّعِيرِ
3490.verse-english: And when it is said to them, "Follow what Allah has revealed," they say, "Rather, we will follow that upon which we found our fathers." Even if Satan was inviting them to the punishment of the Blaze?

clauses-english.clause: And when it is said to them,
"Follow what God has revealed,
" they say,
"Rather,
we will follow that upon which we found our fathers.
" Even if Satan was inviting them to the punishment of the Blaze?

3491.verse-arabic: ۞ وَمَن يُسْلِمْ وَجْهَهُ إِلَى اللَّهِ وَهُوَ مُحْسِنٌ فَقَدِ اسْتَمْسَكَ بِالْعُرْوَةِ الْوُثْقَىٰ ۗ وَإِلَى اللَّهِ عَاقِبَةُ الْأُمُورِ
3491.verse-english: And whoever submits his face to Allah while he is a doer of good - then he has grasped the most trustworthy handhold. And to Allah will be the outcome of [all] matters.

clauses-english.clause: And whoever submits his face to God while he is a doer of good -
then he has grasped the most trustworthy handhold.
And to God will be the outcome of [all] matters.

3492.verse-arabic: وَمَن كَفَرَ فَلَا يَحْزُنكَ كُفْرُهُ ۚ إِلَيْنَا مَرْجِعُهُمْ فَنُنَبِّئُهُم بِمَا عَمِلُوا ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلِيمٌ بِذَاتِ الصُّدُورِ
3492.verse-english: And whoever has disbelieved - let not his disbelief grieve you. To Us is their return, and We will inform them of what they did. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of that within the breasts.

clauses-english.clause: And whoever has disbelieved -
let not his disbelief grieve you.
To Us is their return,
and We will inform them of what they did.
Indeed,
God is Knowing of that within the breasts.

3493.verse-arabic: نُمَتِّعُهُمْ قَلِيلًا ثُمَّ نَضْطَرُّهُمْ إِلَىٰ عَذَابٍ غَلِيظٍ
3493.verse-english: We grant them enjoyment for a little; then We will force them to a massive punishment.

clauses-english.clause: We grant them enjoyment for a little;
then We will force them to a massive punishment.

3494.verse-arabic: وَلَئِن سَأَلْتَهُم مَّنْ خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ لَيَقُولُنَّ اللَّهُ ۚ قُلِ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ۚ بَلْ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
3494.verse-english: And if you asked them, "Who created the heavens and earth?" they would surely say, "Allah." Say, "[All] praise is [due] to Allah "; but most of them do not know.

clauses-english.clause: And if you asked them,
"Who created the heavens and earth?
" they would surely say,
"God.
" Say,
"[All] praise is [due] to God ";
but most of them do not know.

3495.verse-arabic: لِلَّهِ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الْغَنِيُّ الْحَمِيدُ
3495.verse-english: To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth. Indeed, Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.

clauses-english.clause: To God belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth.
Indeed,
God is the Free of need,
the Praiseworthy.

3496.verse-arabic: وَلَوْ أَنَّمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ مِن شَجَرَةٍ أَقْلَامٌ وَالْبَحْرُ يَمُدُّهُ مِن بَعْدِهِ سَبْعَةُ أَبْحُرٍ مَّا نَفِدَتْ كَلِمَاتُ اللَّهِ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزِيزٌ حَكِيمٌ
3496.verse-english: And if whatever trees upon the earth were pens and the sea [was ink], replenished thereafter by seven [more] seas, the words of Allah would not be exhausted. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.

clauses-english.clause: And if whatever trees upon the earth were pens and the sea [was ink],
replenished thereafter by seven [more] seas,
the words of God would not be exhausted.
Indeed,
God is Exalted in Might and Wise.

3497.verse-arabic: مَّا خَلْقُكُمْ وَلَا بَعْثُكُمْ إِلَّا كَنَفْسٍ وَاحِدَةٍ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ سَمِيعٌ بَصِيرٌ
3497.verse-english: Your creation and your resurrection will not be but as that of a single soul. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Seeing.

clauses-english.clause: Your creation and your resurrection will not be but as that of a single soul.
Indeed,
God is Hearing and Seeing.

3498.verse-arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ يُولِجُ اللَّيْلَ فِي النَّهَارِ وَيُولِجُ النَّهَارَ فِي اللَّيْلِ وَسَخَّرَ الشَّمْسَ وَالْقَمَرَ كُلٌّ يَجْرِي إِلَىٰ أَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ خَبِيرٌ
3498.verse-english: Do you not see that Allah causes the night to enter the day and causes the day to enter the night and has subjected the sun and the moon, each running [its course] for a specified term, and that Allah, with whatever you do, is Acquainted?

clauses-english.clause: Do you not see that God causes the night to enter the day and causes the day to enter the night and has subjected the sun and the moon,
each running [its course] for a specified term,
and that God,
with whatever you do,
is Acquainted?

3499.verse-arabic: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الْحَقُّ وَأَنَّ مَا يَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِهِ الْبَاطِلُ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الْعَلِيُّ الْكَبِيرُ
3499.verse-english: That is because Allah is the Truth, and that what they call upon other than Him is falsehood, and because Allah is the Most High, the Grand.

clauses-english.clause: That is because God is the Truth,
and that what they call upon other than Him is falsehood,
and because God is the Most High,
the Grand.

3500.verse-arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ الْفُلْكَ تَجْرِي فِي الْبَحْرِ بِنِعْمَتِ اللَّهِ لِيُرِيَكُم مِّنْ آيَاتِهِ ۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ لِّكُلِّ صَبَّارٍ شَكُورٍ
3500.verse-english: Do you not see that ships sail through the sea by the favor of Allah that He may show you of His signs? Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.

clauses-english.clause: Do you not see that ships sail through the sea by the favor of God that He may show you of His signs?
Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.

3501.verse-arabic: وَإِذَا غَشِيَهُم مَّوْجٌ كَالظُّلَلِ دَعَوُا اللَّهَ مُخْلِصِينَ لَهُ الدِّينَ فَلَمَّا نَجَّاهُمْ إِلَى الْبَرِّ فَمِنْهُم مُّقْتَصِدٌ ۚ وَمَا يَجْحَدُ بِآيَاتِنَا إِلَّا كُلُّ خَتَّارٍ كَفُورٍ
3501.verse-english: And when waves come over them like canopies, they supplicate Allah, sincere to Him in religion. But when He delivers them to the land, there are [some] of them who are moderate [in faith]. And none rejects Our signs except everyone treacherous and ungrateful.

clauses-english.clause: And when waves come over them like canopies,
they supplicate God,
sincere to Him in religion.
But when He delivers them to the land,
there are [some] of them who are moderate [in faith].
And none rejects Our signs except everyone treacherous and ungrateful.

3502.verse-arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ اتَّقُوا رَبَّكُمْ وَاخْشَوْا يَوْمًا لَّا يَجْزِي وَالِدٌ عَن وَلَدِهِ وَلَا مَوْلُودٌ هُوَ جَازٍ عَن وَالِدِهِ شَيْئًا ۚ إِنَّ وَعْدَ اللَّهِ حَقٌّ ۖ فَلَا تَغُرَّنَّكُمُ الْحَيَاةُ الدُّنْيَا وَلَا يَغُرَّنَّكُم بِاللَّهِ الْغَرُورُ
3502.verse-english: O mankind, fear your Lord and fear a Day when no father will avail his son, nor will a son avail his father at all. Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth, so let not the worldly life delude you and be not deceived about Allah by the Deceiver.

clauses-english.clause: O mankind,
fear your Lord and fear a Day when no father will avail his son,
nor will a son avail his father at all.
Indeed,
the promise of God is truth,
so let not the worldly life delude you and be not deceived about God by the Deceiver.

3503.verse-arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ عِندَهُ عِلْمُ السَّاعَةِ وَيُنَزِّلُ الْغَيْثَ وَيَعْلَمُ مَا فِي الْأَرْحَامِ ۖ وَمَا تَدْرِي نَفْسٌ مَّاذَا تَكْسِبُ غَدًا ۖ وَمَا تَدْرِي نَفْسٌ بِأَيِّ أَرْضٍ تَمُوتُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلِيمٌ خَبِيرٌ
3503.verse-english: Indeed, Allah [alone] has knowledge of the Hour and sends down the rain and knows what is in the wombs. And no soul perceives what it will earn tomorrow, and no soul perceives in what land it will die. Indeed, Allah is Knowing and Acquainted.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
God [alone] has knowledge of the Hour and sends down the rain and knows what is in the wombs.
And no soul perceives what it will earn tomorrow,
and no soul perceives in what land it will die.
Indeed,
God is Knowing and Acquainted.
